data.scheme_name: New Industrial Policy 2020-25 - Incentives and Concessions - For General Category (Male Entrepreneurs) - Existing
data.benefits: The Scheme provides various incentives such as exemption from stamp duty, Registration Charges, Tax on Electricity Tariff and reimbursement of Land Conversion Fee, Power Subsidy.
data.eligibility: Units engaged in Manufacturing and Manufacturing-related service industries are eligible under the scheme.
data.conditions: The exemption of stamp duty and concessional registration charges are also applicable to lands purchased under Section 109 of the KLR Act, 1961 and also for direct purchase of industrially converted lands for the projects approved by SLSWCC / DLSWCC.
data.beneficiaries: Units engaged in Manufacturing and Manufacturing-related service industries are eligible under the scheme.
data.prerequisites:
1. The exemption of stamp duty and concessional registration charges are also applicable to lands purchased under Section 109 of the KLR Act, 1961 and also for direct purchase of industrially converted lands for the projects approved by SLSWCC / DLSWCC. 
  2. This incentive will also be applicable for the land transferred by KIADB to landowners as compensation for the acquired land. 
  3. The exemption of stamp duty and concessional registration charges are also available for registration of final sale deed in respect of lands, sheds, plots, industrial tenements after the expiry of the lease period at the rate as specified in the Industrial Policy which was in vogue at the time of execution of lease-cum-sale deed. 
  4. Eligible MSMEs shall commence commercial production within 3 years from the date of approval from the DLSWCC / SLSWCC. 
  5. If any enterprise who has not taken approval from the DLSWCC / SLSWCC for their project for any reason shall commence commercial production within 3 years from the date of taking possession of land / building or taking building plan approval.
data.nodal_agency: Commerce and Industries Department, Government of Karnataka
data.context: Government is pleased to announce the New Industrial Policy 2020-25, to build on the strengths of Karnatakas industry and to enable it to fulfill its role as the engine of growth and to shoulder responsibility of adding more hi-tech value and employment. The new industrial revolution presents new opportunities for industry, particularly manufacturing and manufacturing-related service industries. These developments are enabling smart manufacturing, customization, collaborative production and other new production modes and business models.
data.objective: The aim is to attract INR 5 Lakh crore in investments, create 20 lakh jobs, achieve 3rd position in merchandise exports, maintain a 10% industrial growth rate, and foster an ecosystem for technology adoption and innovation.
data.description:
Non - Monetary - Preferential Levy (Taxes/Penalties/Fees/Royalties)- 

  1. Stamp Duty Exemption- 
    • Zone 1 : 100% 
    • Zone 2 : 100% 
    • Zone 3 : No Benefit for this Zone 
  2. Concessional Registration Charges for MSMEs- 
    • Zone 1, Zone 2: Concession of INR 1/- per INR 1,000/- 
    • Zone 3 : No Benefit for this Zone 
  3. Exemption from Tax on Electricity Tariff for MSMEs- 
    • Zone 1 : 100% for 7 years 
    • Zone 2 : 100% for 6 years 
    • Zone 3 : No Benefit for this Zone 
  4. Power Subsidy- 
    • For Zone 1 & 2 only: Reimbursements at INR 1.00/- per unit consumed of cost of power paid for a period of 3 years 
  5. Reimbursements of Land Conversion Fee for MSMEs- 
    • Zone 1 and 2: 100% 
    • Zone 3: No benefit
data.how_to_apply: Applicant can register themselves on EBIZ- https://ebiz.karnataka.gov.in/kum/InvestorRegistrationForm.aspx
data.funding_facilitator: Commerce and Industries Department, Government of Karnataka
data.funding_mechanism: Amount will be disbursed to the beneficiary after approval of the application by the concerned authority.
data.additional_info:
1. Zonal Classification-
    • Zone 1: Holalkere, Channagiri, Jagalur, Honnali, Gudibande, Bagepalli, Chickaballapura, Srinivasapura, Soraba, Hosanagara, Shikaripura, Madhugiri, Koratagere, Gubbi, Pavagada, Chikkanayakanahalli, Yelandur, Gundlupet, Hanur, Chamarajanagar, Kollegal, Arakalgud, Belur, Arasikere, Madikeri, Somwarpet, Virajpet, Ponnampete, Kushalnagar, Bilagi, Badami, Mudhol, Jamkhandi, Hunagund, Guledgudda, Rabakavi-Banahatti, Terdal, Ilkal, Bagalkote, Bailhongal, Soundathi, Chikkodi, Raibag, Khanapur, Ramdurg, Hukkeri, Athani, Gokak, Nippani, Kagavadi, Mudalgi, Yaragatti, Kittur, Belagavi, Sindgi, Indi, Muddebihal, B Bagewadi, Alamela, Babaleshwar, Nidagundi, Tikota, Chedachana, Kolhar, Devarahipparagi, Talikote. Vijayapura, Navalgund, Kalghatagi, Kundaghol, Annigeri, Alnavar, Hubballi (R), Dharwada, Hubballi(U), Mundargi, Nargund, Ron, Shirahatti, Gajendragad, Lakshmeshwar, Gadag, Savanur, Shiggaon, Hirekerur, Hanagal, Ranebennur, Byadagi, Rattihalli, Haveri, Honnavar, Sirsi, Mundagod, Yellapura, Siddapura, Haliyal, Joida, Bhatkal, Ankola, Kumta, Dandeli, Karwar, H B Halli, Hadagalli, Kudligi, Hospet, Sandur, Siraguppa, Harappana Halli, Kurogod, Kottur, Kampli, Ballari, Bhalki, Humnabad,, BasavaKalyana, Aurad, Chitaguppa, Hulusur, Kamala Nagar, Bidar, Afzalpur, Aland, Jewargi, Sedam, Chittapur, Chincholi, Kalagi, Kamalapur, Yedrami, Shahabad, Kalaburagi, Yadgiri, Shahapur, Shorapur, Hunasagi, Vadagera, Gurumitkal, Kushtagi, Yelburga, Gangavathi, Kukkunur, Karatagi, Kanakagiri, Koppal, Sindhanur, Manvi, Lingasugur, Devadurga, Maski, Siravara, Raichur.
    • Zone 2: Magadi, Ramanagara, Channapatna, Kanakapura, Harohalli, Hiriyur, Chitradurga, Challakere, Hosadurga, Molkalmuru, Davanagere, Harihar, Nyamati, Chintamani, Gowribidanur, Siddlaghatta, Cheluru, Bangarpet, KGF, Kolar, Malur, Mulbagal, Sagar, ThirthahaIli, Shivamogga, Bhadravathi, Turuvekere, Sira, Tiptur, Kunigal, Tumakur, Kadur, Mudigere, Tarikere, Chikkamagaluru, Ajjampur, Shringeri, Koppa, N R Pura, Kalasa, Bantwal, Sulya, Belthangadi, Puttur, Mulki, Ullal, Moodbidri, Kadaba, Mangalore, Alur, C R Patna, Shantigrama, Hassan, H N Pura, Sakleshpura, Srirangapatna, Pandavapura, Mandya, Maddur, Nagamangala, Malavalli, K R Pet, Hunsur, K R Nagara, Mysuru, Nanjangud, T N Pura, Periyapatna, H D Kote, Saraguru, Saligrama, Karkala, Bhramhavara, Udupi, Kundapura, Kapu, Hebri, Baindur.
    • Zone 3: Anekal, Bengaluru (N), Bengaluru (S), Yelahanka, Bengaluru (E), Devanahalli, Doddaballapura, Hoskote, Nelamangala
  2. Enterprises can avail incentives and concessions under any one policy of the State. i.e., Enterprises availing incentives and concessions under Industrial Policy 2020-2025 will not have a choice to avail partly in the Industrial Policy 2020-2025 and partly in any other Policy of the State in vogue and vice-versa, unless otherwise specified by the Government.
  3. To view more details and format sample (Form-3: Investment Promotion Subsidy for Micro, Small & Medium Enterprises) of application- https://ebiz.karnataka.gov.in/kum/PDFS/COMMON%20APPLICATION%20FORM%20AND%20OTHER%20FORMS%20AND%20INSTRUCTIONS.pdf
data.checklist_info_a:
1. Common Application Form* 
2. Land/building-rent/lease agreement (If unit is rented /leased) 
3. Partnership deed / Articles of Association/byelaws 
4. Self-attested Project Report 
5. District Level Single Window Clearance Committee (DLSWCC) / State Level Single Window Clearance Committee (SLSWCC) approval order 
6. Udyam Registration Certificate /Industrial Entrepreneur Memorandum (IEM)/Industrial License (IL)  
7. Caste certificate 
8. Ex-service men certificate, if applicable 
9. Other Basic KYC Documents
